alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 25 at 2:30PM MST until July 26 at 3:15AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Monsoonal moisture in place over the region will lead to multiple periods of thunderstorms capable of heavy rainfall and flash flooding. This risk will be greatest for burn scars, but several area roads could also experience flooding as a result of the multiple rounds of heavy rainfall through Tuesday night. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by multiple rounds of thunderstorms producing excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following area, Northwest Plateau. * WHEN...Through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - In addition to flash flooding, these thunderstorms will be capable of producing gusty outflow winds over 40 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
